array.Name: DCOS
array.Description: The Deep Space Optical Communication experiment uses a flight laser transceiver and ground laser transmitter and receiver. It is a new technology for increasing bandwidth.

array.Name: Gamma Ray Spectrometer
array.Description: This instrument measures the distribution of the intensity of gamma radiation versus the energy of photon.

array.Name: Hull-effect Thruster
array.Description: This instrument uses a magnetic field to ionize the propellent and produce thrust.

array.Name: Multilayer Insulation
array.Description: This is thermal material reduces heat loss by thermal radiation.

array.Name: Multispectral Imager
array.Description: This device captures images within wavelengths across the electromagnetic spectrum invisible to the human eye.

array.Name: Neutron Spectrometer
array.Description: This instrument detects neutrons in different energy bands and is used for finding hydrogen.

array.Name: Propellant
array.Description: This type of propellant uses xenon and is the most common used for ion propulsion.

array.Name: Solar Panel
array.Description: This instrument absorbs the sun's rays as a source of energy for generating electricity and heating.

array.Name: X-Band Radio
array.Description: This instrument uses microwaves in the range of 8-12 GHz and offer higher data rates and accuracy than other bands.
